Home → Recommendations & reviews → Booked Out podcast

Booked Out podcast

Booked Out is our monthly book recommendation podcast, from Woodbridge Library’s Kellie Dimmock, Richard Baker, Sheila Haskins and Sophie Green.

June 2015: Brave New Reads

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Jun 1, 2015

Sophie Green and guests discuss the six titles selected as Brave New Reads for 2015: The Dead Lake by Hamid Ismailov, Fallen Land by Patrick Flanery, Black Country by Liz Berry, Any Other Mouth by Anneliese Mackintosh, Badgerlands by Patrick Barkham and Prayers for the Stolen by Jennifer Clements.

May 2015: Cookery books

Written by The Booked Out team · Published May 1, 2015

Kellie and guests discuss their favourite cooks and cookery books including Sous Chef: 24 Hours in the Kitchen by Michael Gibney, Eat: The Little Book of Fast Food by Nigel Slater, Nigella Lawson's How to be a Domestic Goddess and James Martin's Great British Winter Cookbook.

April 2015: Lucky dip

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Apr 1, 2015

In this improvised 'Lucky Dip' edition, Sheila and guests review a random selection of titles and explore the art of judging books by their covers. Books discussed include Little Women by Louisa M Alcott, Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury, The Little Old Lady who Struck Lucky Again by Catharina Ingelman-Sundberg, When I was a Nipper by Alan Titchmarsh and Kenneth Grahame: An Innocent in the Wild Wood by Alison Prince.

March 2015: Irish writers

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Mar 1, 2015

Irish Writers. In celebration of St. Patrick's Day, Sophie Green and guests discuss titles by Irish Writers available through Suffolk Libraries including Amongst Women by John McGahern, History of the Rain by Niall Williams, Nora Webster by Colm Toibin and The Butcher Boy by Patrick McCabe.

February 2015: Love is in the air

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Feb 1, 2015

Love is in the Air. Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Romance in titles available through Suffolk Libraries including North and South by Elizabeth Gaskell, Uncommon Arrangements by Katie Roiphe, Love Lessons by Joan Wynham, Vivien's Heavenly Ice Cream Shop by Abby Clements and Fifty Shades of Grey by E.L. James

January 2015: Graphic novels

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Jan 1, 2015

Richard Baker and guests discuss Graphic Novels available through Suffolk Libraries including DC Comics, Minutemen/Silk Spectre, Alan Moore's V for Vendetta and Watchmen and Ordinary Victories by Manu Larcenet.

December 2014: Now that’s what I call… the best of 2014

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Dec 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests round up the year with recommendations from library staff and customers including The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry by Rachel Joyce, The Miniaturist by Jessie Burton, Adam Fould’s In the Wolf’s Mouth and River Cottage Light and Easy – Healthy Recipes for Every Day by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, plus the films Gravity and Philomena.

November 2014: The best of the box sets

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Nov 1, 2014

Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss The Killing, Mad Men, Game of Thrones and Our Zoo.

October 2014: Novellas and short fiction

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Oct 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss The Testament of Mary by Colm Toibin, On Chesil Beach by Ian McEwan, Will Not Attend by Adam Resnick, Hotel du Lac by Anita Brookner and The End of the Affair by Graham Greene.

September 2014: Things that go bump in the night

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Sep 1, 2014

Sheila Haskins and guests review some titles that will give you the creeps.
